metadata.title: CVE-2013-0238 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The try_parse_v4_netmask function in hostmask.c in IRCD-Hybrid before 8.0.6does not properly validate masks, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (crash) via a mask that causes a negative number to beparsed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0238` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ircd-hybrid - 1:7.2.2.dfsg.2-10ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ircd-hybrid package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.2.2.dfsg.2-10ubuntu1').
